intro: Orthosia rubens, commonly known as the redstem orthosia, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Orthosia rubens thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant ecosystems.
